business.headline: India's Q1 GDP grows at 6.7%, lowest in 5 quartersQ1 GDP growth: While the 6.7% growth is broadly in line with what experts had estimated, it falls short of the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) projection of 7.2% for the same period.
ITR e-verification: You will have to pay penalty if...If you miss the 30-day window to e-verify, the date you finally verify your ITR will be considered as the filing date.
Explained: Why Reliance's bonus issue left brokerages unimpressedIt may be noted that there was no word on the potential listing of RIL's two key businesses—Reliance Jio and Reliance Retail.

Paytm shares rise over 12% today: What should investors do?This rise in shares comes amid important developments within the company, including the recent sale of its entertainment ticketing business to online food aggregator Zomato for Rs 2,048 crore.

Simplified pension form launched for retiring government staff. Check detailsThe new form consolidates nine separate forms into a single, unified Form 6A. It also offers the option to download the ePPO, ensuring a seamless transition from employment to retirement.
Sensex, Nifty end higher as investors await Q1 GDP data; RVNL up 4%The S&P BSE Sensex rose 231.16 points to 82,365.77, while the NSE NIfty50 settled 83.95 higher at 25,235.90.

India Q1 GDP growth preview: What to watch out for Analysts predict growth in the range of 6%-7.1% for Q1 FY25, compared with 7.8% in the previous quarter (Q4 FY24). Rating agencies and financial institutions have varying expectations for Q1 GDP growth.
RVNL shares cross Rs 600 mark after jumping 5%. What's behind the rally?Shares of this multibagger railway PSU have sharply corrected over the past month but are still up over 230% year-to-date.

Reliance bonus issue: What is it and how will it benefit shareholders?A bonus issue, also known as a bonus share issue, occurs when a company distributes additional shares to its existing shareholders at no cost to them.

'Jan Dhan Yojana pivotal in boosting financial inclusion': PM ModiSpeaking at the Global Fintech Fest (GFF), he mentioned how the scheme has been a game-changer in ensuring that banking services reach every corner of the country.

UK's Aviva found guilty in $26 million fake invoice scandal in India: ReportBritish insurer Aviva has been accused of violating regulations in India by using fake invoices and secret cash payments to bypass commission limits for sales agents.

Vistara-Air India merger: Check impact on ticket bookings, flight operations and moreVistara-Air India merger: Travelers can expect expanded services and improved connectivity. Read on to see how this change will impact your bookings, flight operations, and travel experience.

No Vistara flight bookings from September 3 ahead of merger with Air IndiaVistara-Air India merger: Starting from September 3, 2024, customers will no longer be able to book Vistara flights for travel on or after November 12, 2024. Bookings for these routes will be redirected to Air India's website.

Premier Energies IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check status Premier Energies IPO allotment: Investors can check their Premier Energies IPO allotment status online via the BSE website or Kfin Technologies Limited, the issue's registrar.

Sensex, Nifty open at record highs as Moody's lifts India's GDP forecast to 7.2%The S&P BSE Sensex added 502.42 points to 82,637.03, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 87.45 points to 25,239.40.

RIL AGM: Mukesh Ambani bullish on Reliance's growth; no word on Jio, Retail IPOsMukesh Ambani was bullish on the conglomerate's growth and said that Reliance was on track to more than double in size before the end of this decade.

Shah Rukh Khan enters Hurun India Rich List with Rs 7,300 crore net worthKnown for his recent hits like 'Jawan' and 'Pathaan', Khan's wealth isn't just from his successful film career but also from his stakes in the IPL team, Kolkata Knight Riders, which have significantly increased in value.
Sensex, Nifty end higher driven by gains in RIL stock The S&P BSE Sensex added 349.05 points to end at 82,134.61, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 99.60 points to close at 25,151.95.

RIL AGM: Reliance retail in top 5 globally in terms of stores The company also ranks among the top ten retailers worldwide in terms of market capitalisation and is in the top twenty for the number of employees.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: PM Modi's apology after collapse of Shivaji statue: He is our deityPM Modi's apology comes amid an outrage in Maharashtra over the incident as Shivaji Maharaj is a revered figure and his legacy is a sensitive issue in the state.

Avani Lekhara shoots 2nd gold with new Paralympic record, bronze for Mona AgarwalParis Paralympics: India's Avani Lekhara won her second gold medal in the women's 10m Air Rifle Standing SH1 shooting event, defending her crown. She broke her Paralympic record from Tokyo in the final on Friday. Mona Agarwal won bronze in the event.

India's Q1 GDP grows at 6.7%, lowest in 5 quartersQ1 GDP growth: While the 6.7% growth is broadly in line with what experts had estimated, it falls short of the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) projection of 7.2% for the same period.

1984 Anti-Sikh riots: Delhi court orders to frame charges against Jagdish TytlerDelhi's Rouse Avenue Court on Friday ordered the framing of charges against former Congress MP Jagdish Tytler in connection with the 1984 anti-Sikh riots case. relating to killings of Sikhs in Delhi's Pul Bangash area.

Should newlyweds live on their own for the first few years of marriage?While living independently can help newlyweds learn to adjust and bond better, it also presents its own set of challenges and might not be a guaranteed solution for a successful marriage.

IC 814 hijacking in images: When India was held hostage for 7 daysA visual and text retelling of the hijacking of Air India IC 814 in 1999. How India lost the opportunity of taking action at Amritsar, and ended up releasing three terrorists, including Masood Azhar. This is how the whole nation was kept on tenterhooks for seven days, and ultimately heaved a collective sigh of relief.

Era of uninterrupted dialogue over: S Jaishankar talks tough on Pakistan External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said the focus is now on determining the nature of India's relationship with Pakistan, and that India will react to events, whether they take a positive or negative direction.

Hidden camera in girls' washroom in Andhra hostel, massive protests eruptA hidden camera was discovered in a girls' hostel washroom at Gudlavalleru College of Engineering in Andhra Pradesh, sparking a protest by the students.

ISI's gift to hijackers of Indian Airlines plane in Lahore: Paper-wrapped pistolBefore IC 814 was hijacked and taken to Kandahar, the hijacking of an Indian Airlines plane in 1984 by Khalistani terrorists remained the longest in Indian aviation history. The hijackers faked weapons initially, but got a paper-wrapped pistol from Pakistan's ISI after they diverted the plane to Lahore. Here's the story of the hijacking of IC 421 on its 40th anniversary.

Supreme Court asks Omar Abdullah, his estranged wife to appear for mediationThe top court was reviewing an appeal against the Delhi High Court's decision to dismiss a petition filed by the former J&K Chief Minister Omar Abdullah, who is seeking a divorce from his estranged wife.

Assam Chief Minister scraps 2-hour namaz breaks on Friday in AssemblyAssam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma announced the cancellation of the two-hour namaz break on Fridays in the Assam Legislative Assembly.

How Shivaji statue collapse incident has exposed cracks in Mahayuti allianceThe growing tension among the Mahayuti alliance partners was palpable as the Shiv Sena, the NCP and the BJP spoke in different voices over the collapse of the statue of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj.

How Aurangzeb got his brother Dara Shikoh beheaded over his religious beliefsDespite his brilliance as a poet, writer, and philosopher, Dara Shikoh could not seize the throne. Aurangzeb, with his ruthless ambition, claimed the 'Peacock Throne' instead.

Video: Man assaults cab driver, slams him on ground for bumping into his luxury carThe taxi driver was admitted to a hospital and his statement was recorded by the police when he regained consciousness.

Why 'Tumbbad' is the most iconic blend of folk, fantasy and horror'Tumbbad' has been re-released in theatres six years after it first hit the screens in 2018. Directed by Rahi Anil Barve, and starring Sohum Shah in the lead, here's why it is an out-of-the-world experience. Even in the literal sense of the term.
Woman fakes accident by falling in front of moving car in Bengaluru. VideoA woman faked an accident by deliberately falling in front of a moving car in Bengaluru. The video has gone viral.
Acid attack, rain, and a gangrape-murder that shook Bengal 42 years agoA cold-blooded gangrape and murder on a rainy June night in 1982 left the town of Cooch Behar, in West Bengal, scarred forever.

BJP's Locket Chatterjee among several detained, heavy police deployment in KolkataProtests intensified on Friday in Kolkata as members of the BJP women's wing took to the streets, demanding justice for the rape and murder victim who was killed inside the state-run RG Kar Medical College in Kolkata on August 9. A large police presence has been deployed across the city as opposition parties step up their protests against West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee. Meanwhile, Banerjee has written to Prime Minister Narendra Modi, seeking stringent central legislation in cases of rape and murder. Stay tuned to IndiaToday.in for the latest developments in the protest in Kolkata.

Lured to hotel, stripped, assaulted: Actor's charge against director RanjithThe Malayalam film actor alleges that in 2012, he was summoned by filmmaker Ranjith to the Taj Hotel in Bengaluru in the guise of an interview, and was later forced to strip and sexually assaulted.

Meet new Scorpio-N, Safari, Hector Plus rival launching on September 9The SUV offers more than 70 Bluelink connected-car features along with smartwatch and smartphone connectivity, and over 270 embedded VR commands.

Man plays Shah Rukh Khan's iconic 'Mohabbatein' tune on violin in video from London  On Liverpool Street in London, an Indian woman spotted a man playing Shah Rukh Khan's iconic 'Mohabbatein' instrumental on the violin.

Rimi Sen sues Land Rover over faulty car, demands Rs 50 crore for inconvenienceActor Rimi Sen has accused luxury car manufacturer Land Rover of causing her mental harassment due to ongoing repair issues with her car. She has demanded Rs 50 crore in damages over alleged defects.

Inspired by Paralympics videos, sprinter Preethi Pal wins bronze in Paris 2024 Paris Paralympics: Preethi Pal, 23, won bronze in the women's 100m T35 event on Friday, August 30. At 17, she watched videos of the Paralympic Games on social media and set out to achieve her dreams. In Paris, she won India's first track and field medal in the Paris 2024 event.

Burnt-out Carlos Alcaraz calls out 'tight scheduling' after shock US Open exitCarlos Alcaraz highlighted the tight scheduling of the tennis calendar after his shocking second-round exit from the US Open 2024 after loss to Botic van de Zandschulp.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
